item.title: Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya Bring Tail Of India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike - News18
item.description:
Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya Showcase India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike

Publication Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

The trailer for the highly anticipated movie, Sky Force, featuring Akshay Kumar, has been released, revealing a story set against the backdrop of the 1965 India-Pakistan Air War.

  • The trailer introduces the intense characters of Indian Air Force officers portrayed by Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya.
  • Akshay features prominently, delivering a warning to Pakistan and announcing India's first airstrike.
  • Veer Pahariya's character goes missing during the strike, creating suspense about his fate.
  • The film also stars Sara Ali Khan, who plays Veer's love interest.
  • Directed by Sandeep Kewlani and Abhishek Kapur, the film will be released on January 24, 2025.
“This Republic Day, witness the untold story of a heroic sacrifice – the tale of India’s first and deadliest airstrike.” - Akshay Kumar

Sky Force is generating significant excitement among fans, with some hailing it as a potential blockbuster.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar snubbed by Cricket Australia, legend has 'no clue why' - The Times of India
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Snubbed by Cricket Australia, Legend Has 'No Clue Why'

Publication Date: Recent Source: Times of India

In a surprising turn of events, legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar expressed his confusion regarding his absence from the Border-Gavaskar Trophy presentation ceremony at the Sydney Cricket Ground. While Gavaskar was present at the venue for commentary, only Allan Border was on stage during the ceremony, prompting Gavaskar to comment, 'I don't know, ask Cricket Australia.'

  • Sunil Gavaskar was present at the venue but was not invited on stage during the presentation ceremony.
  • Cricket Australia acknowledged it would have been preferable for both Gavaskar and Border to have shared the stage.
  • Australia won the fifth Test against India, claiming the series 3-1 after a decade-long wait for the trophy.
  • Gavaskar completed his broadcast duties before leaving the venue, indicating scheduling was not an issue.
“I don't know, ask Cricket Australia.” - Sunil Gavaskar

This incident has raised questions regarding the decisions made by Cricket Australia, especially considering Gavaskar's legendary status in cricket.

item.title: Poco X7, X7 Pro launch on January 9: Key specs revealed ahead of debut - Kalinga TV
item.description:
Poco X7 and X7 Pro Set to Launch on January 9 with Key Specifications Revealed

Publication Date: January 4, 2025 Source: Kalinga TV

Poco is preparing to launch its latest smartphone series, the Poco X7 and Poco X7 Pro, in India on January 9, 2025. Ahead of the launch, several key specifications have been confirmed.

  • The Poco X7 will feature IP68 and IP69 ratings for water and dust resistance.
  • It sports a 1.5K 3D curved AMOLED display with a 120Hz adaptive refresh rate and 3,000 nits peak brightness.
  • Protected by Gorilla Glass Victus 2 and supports Dolby Vision and HDR10+.
  • The X7 Pro features a 50MP primary Sony LYT 600 camera with OIS and a 20MP selfie camera.
  • It supports 4K video recording at 60 FPS with OIS and EIS.
  • The base price for the Poco X7 Pro will be under Rs 30,000, with a Dimensity 8400 Ultra SoC.
  • Additional features include LPDDR5X RAM, UFS 4.0 storage, HyperOS 2, 90W charging, and a 6,600 mAh battery.

Poco will also introduce a special Iron Man Edition of the X7 Pro during the launch event.

item.title: South Korea protesters rally for, against Yoon arrest as deadline looms - Reuters
item.description:
South Korea protesters rally for, against Yoon arrest as deadline looms

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Reuters

Thousands gathered in Seoul amid heavy snow to rally both for and against the arrest of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol as a critical legal deadline approaches.

  • Yoon's lawyers claim the arrest warrant is unconstitutional.
  • The arrest warrant against Yoon expires at 1500 GMT on Monday.
  • The Seoul Western District Court has rejected a complaint about the warrant being illegal.
"Judging the legitimacy of any legal interpretation and execution is difficult." - Seok Dong-hyeon, lawyer advising Yoon

The protests underscore a deepening political crisis in South Korea, as the nation grapples with the implications of a presidential impeachment.

item.title: "You Could Be More Sensible": Gautam Gambhir Left Fuming At Reporter Over Rohit Sharma Question - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Critiques Media Coverage on Rohit Sharma During Press Conference

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, Gautam Gambhir expressed frustration at media portrayals of Rohit Sharma's decisions during the Test series against Australia, emphasizing team over individual interests.

  • Australia won the Sydney Test, concluding the series 3-1.
  • Rohit Sharma opted out of the last match, while Jasprit Bumrah was injured.
  • Gambhir criticized reports questioning Rohit's leadership and called for more sensible commentary.
  • He stated that players should prioritize team and country over personal interests.
  • He acknowledged the absence of Bumrah, stating the team shouldn't rely on one individual.
“...you could be more sensible about it. When a captain or leader takes a call, keeping the team in mind, I don't think there's anything bad.” - Gautam Gambhir

Gambhir’s comments highlight the ongoing pressures and scrutiny on team leaders in sports, emphasizing the importance of teamwork over individual performance.

item.title: HYDRAA begins demolition of illegal building in Hyderabad - The Siasat Daily
item.description:
HYDRAA Initiates Demolition of Illegal Building in Hyderabad

Date: January 5, 2025
Source: Siasat Daily

The Hyderabad Disaster Response Assets Protection Agency (HYDRAA) has started demolishing an illegal building in Hyderabad, utilizing heavy machinery at Ayyappa Society.

  • HYDRAA Commissioner AV Ranganath inspected the illegal building site after receiving a complaint.
  • The building is constructed on 684 yards in Khanamet, Serilingampally, and has disregarded multiple demolition notices.
  • The GHMC issued notices on February 14 and February 26, 2024, but construction continued despite earlier demolition attempts.
  • HYDRAA's commissioner will address public grievances related to encroachments on January 6.
  • A HYDRAA police unit is set to be established in Hyderabad prior to Sankranti.
“Based on the High Court’s order, the GHMC had partly demolished the structure, but construction continued unabated.”

This demolition reflects HYDRAA's commitment to enforce building regulations and protect public safety. The agency's proactive measures aim to curb illegal constructions in Hyderabad.

item.title: "Just Because I'm An Indian...": Sunil Gavaskar On Not Being Invited To Present Border-Gavaskar Trop.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Just Because I'm An Indian...: Sunil Gavaskar On Not Being Invited To Present Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Code Sports

Sunil Gavaskar, the legendary cricketer, expressed his disappointment after being overlooked during the presentation ceremony for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which honors both him and Allan Border. This event followed Australia's six-wicket victory over India in the series.

  • Sunil Gavaskar was present at the venue but was not invited to present the trophy.
  • Australia reclaimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after a ten-year gap.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of the trophy, stating it signifies the rivalry between India and Australia.
  • The recent series drew record crowds and broke a long-standing attendance record at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
"Just because I am an Indian. I would have been happy to present the trophy with my good friend Allan Border," - Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's comments highlight the significance of his role in cricket and the expectations surrounding such iconic trophies.

item.title: What is Indian-origin Kevan Parekh’s salary as Apple’s new CFO? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What is Indian-origin Kevan Parekh’s salary as Apple’s new CFO?

Date: January 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Indian-origin Kevan Parekh, appointed as the CFO of Apple effective January 1, 2025, will receive an annual salary of $1 million (₹8.57 crore).

  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and has significant experience in finance roles.
  • He previously held leadership positions at Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Parekh succeeds Luca Maestri in Apple's CFO transition plan.
  • Tim Cook praised Parekh's intelligence and judgment in his new role.
  • His annual compensation includes participation in Apple’s Executive Cash Incentive Plan with a target opportunity of 175% of base salary.
“For more than a decade, Kevan has been an indispensable member of Apple's finance leadership team.” – Tim Cook

This appointment highlights Apple’s commitment to maintaining strong financial leadership during a key transition period.

item.title: Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir

Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

In a recent press conference, India’s head coach Gautam Gambhir praised Rohit Sharma for prioritizing the team's needs over his personal batting form during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which India lost 1-3 to Australia.

  • Rohit Sharma missed the first Test to be with his family for the birth of his second child.
  • He batted in the middle order for two Tests to maintain the opening partnership but struggled with scores of 3 and 6.
  • His return to the opening position in the fourth Test did not improve his score, adding just 11 runs.
  • Eventually, he rested for the final Test after a prolonged slump in form.
  • Gambhir emphasized Rohit’s accountability, stating, "To keep the dressing room happy, I have to be honest and fair to everyone."
  • The loss against Australia means India missed out on the World Test Championship final and ended a decade-long hold on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top," said Gautam Gambhir.

This series loss highlights the challenges the Indian cricket team is currently facing as they undergo a transitional phase.

item.title: Venus dazzles next to crescent Moon in rare celestial spectacle - NewsBytes
item.description:
Venus dazzles next to crescent Moon in rare celestial spectacle

Date: January 2023 Source: NewsBytes

This week, a mesmerizing celestial event unfolded as Venus, our nearest planetary neighbor, shone brightly above a crescent Moon.

  • The spectacle was visible to the naked eye in several regions including the UK, US, Turkey, China, and India.
  • Venus's alignment with the Moon is a rare occurrence, making it a captivating event for stargazers.
  • Upcoming celestial events include the Quadrantid meteor shower peaking and Mars' opposition in January.
  • Stargazers are advised to find locations away from light pollution for optimal viewing.
“Dr. Robert Massey, the Deputy Director of the UK's Royal Astronomical Society, advises stargazers to allow at least 15 minutes for their eyes to adjust to darkness.”

This celestial spectacle serves as a reminder of the beauty of our night sky and the rarity of such events, encouraging continued interest in astronomy.

item.title: Gold Rate And Silver Price Today on January 5, 2025: Check latest Rates in India | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Gold Rate And Silver Price Today on January 5, 2025: Check latest Rates in India

Source: Livemint

Gold prices experienced a modest decrease on January 5, 2025, with significant changes in gold and silver rates across major cities in India.

Key Points:

  • The cost of 22 carat gold is Rs.7232.3 per gram, down by ₹460.0.

This is an AI-generated story and has not been edited by Livemint staff.

item.title: Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C

Date: Published on January 5, 2025

Source: Times of India

Severe fog conditions in Delhi have led to significant delays in flights and trains, with temperatures dropping to as low as 10°C. The weather situation has caused widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Dense fog has resulted in multiple flight cancellations and delays.
  • Train services have been severely affected, with many trains running late.
  • Weather forecasts predict continued fog conditions for the next few days.
“The visibility is very low, affecting both air and rail transport.”

Officials are advising travelers to check the status of their journeys before heading out and to remain patient as the weather conditions persist.

item.title: 5 most beautiful images of nebula captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
item.description:
5 Most Beautiful Images of Nebula Captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: India.com

This article showcases the five most beautiful nebula images captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique characteristics and significance to astronomy.

  • The Ghost Nebula in the constellation of Cassiopeia exhibits flowing veils of gas and dust.
  • The Horsehead Nebula is shown in infrared light to commemorate the Hubble's launch anniversary.
  • The Eagle Nebula, also known as Messier 16, has provided numerous iconic images.
  • The Orion Nebula is noted for having the sharpest view obtained by Hubble.
  • The image of NGC 6530 depicts a wall of smoke blended with bright stars.
“Thanks for reading!”

This article celebrates the beauty and significance of nebula imagery captured by Hubble, inspiring further exploration and appreciation of the universe.

item.title: "Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 • Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, India head coach Gautam Gambhir addressed questions regarding the future of senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma following the team's defeat in Sydney.

  • Gambhir refused to comment definitively on the future of Kohli and Sharma, citing their 'hunger' as a deciding factor.
  • He emphasized the need to be fair to all players in the team, regardless of experience.
  • Both players have struggled with form recently, raising questions about their selection for upcoming matches.
  • Rohit Sharma appeared in an interview expressing his commitment to continue playing despite retirement rumors.
  • The selectors face challenges in deciding the future of the veteran players as India prepares for a series in England.
"I can't comment on the future of any Players, it is up to them. They have the hunger and commitment - hopefully they can do everything they can to take Indian cricket forward." - Gautam Gambhir

The upcoming selections for India's Test squad will significantly impact the team's future dynamics, especially concerning seasoned players like Kohli and Sharma.

item.title: Poco X7, Poco X7 Pro India Launch Roundup: Check Full Specifications, Availability, and Expected Pricing - Gizbot
item.description:
Poco X7, Poco X7 Pro India Launch Roundup: Check Full Specifications, Availability, and Expected Pricing

Published: Sunday, January 5, 2025 - Source: Gizbot

The Poco X7 series is set to launch in India on January 9, 2025, featuring the Poco X7 and Poco X7 Pro models. The Poco X7 Pro will be a rebranded Redmi Turbo 4.

  • The launch event will be livestreamed on YouTube and mi.com starting at 5:30 PM IST.
  • Prices are expected to be under Rs 30,000 for the Poco X7 Pro and under Rs 25,000 for the Poco X7.
  • Poco X7 Pro specifications include MediaTek's Dimensity 8400-Ultra SoC and a 50MP triple-camera setup.
  • Poco X7 rumored specs feature MediaTek Dimensity 7300-Ultra, 5,110mAh battery, and 120Hz AMOLED display.
"The Poco X7 Pro is expected to debut with an impressive AnTuTu score exceeding 1.7 million points."

This launch is anticipated to stir interest in the mid-range smartphone market in India, especially among gamers and tech enthusiasts.

item.title: Here’s what you can get at India’s ₹100 crore addresses | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Luxury Living: Exploring India's ₹100 Crore Homes

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mint

In India, the dream of owning a home priced at over ₹100 crore reflects the aspirations of its billionaires, showcasing opulent features like sea-facing bedrooms and exclusive amenities.

  • 185 billionaires in India are pursuing luxurious homes costing over ₹100 crore.
  • Some properties feature 800-1200 sq. ft. sea-facing bedrooms in prime locations like Pali Hill, Mumbai.
  • Luxury amenities often include golf courses in courtyards and top-tier culinary services.
The final stage of Maslow’s hierarchy is self-actualization, achieved for some through exclusive real estate investments.

This trend exemplifies the rising demand for luxury real estate in India, reflecting both wealth and lifestyle aspirations among its elite.

item.title: BJP MLA claims ‘50,000 cows slaughtered daily in Uttar Pradesh’, accuses govt of silence - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP MLA Claims 50,000 Cows Slaughtered Daily in Uttar Pradesh

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA Nand Kishore Gujar has alleged that the Yogi Adityanath government is complicit in the daily slaughter of 50,000 cows in Uttar Pradesh, expressing concerns over official corruption and urging resolution at the highest levels.

  • Nand Kishore Gujar claims 50,000 cows are slaughtered every day under the current government.
  • He alleges that corrupt officials are misusing funds meant for cow welfare.
  • Gujar expresses frustration over the lack of government action on this issue.
  • He warns that unchecked corruption could affect the BJP's performance in the upcoming elections.
  • Akhilesh Yadav criticizes BJP infighting and its impact on public interests.
  • A separate incident highlights a lynching in Moradabad linked to cow slaughter accusations.
“If action is taken against these corrupt officials, the BJP could win as many as 375 seats in the next assembly elections.”

The claims by MLA Gujar shed light on serious allegations against officials in Uttar Pradesh, raising questions regarding animal welfare and government accountability.

item.title: HMPV outbreak in China: Telangana health department issues dos & don’ts - The Times of India
item.description:
HMPV Outbreak in China: Telangana Health Department Issues Guidelines

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Telangana Health Department

The Telangana health department has issued dos and don’ts in response to the HMPV outbreak in China, highlighting the importance of preventive measures.

  • The health department is raising awareness about Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), which is affecting individuals in China.
  • Guidelines include recommendations on hygiene practices and precautions to prevent infection.
  • Officials are monitoring the situation closely and providing regular updates to the public.
“Prevention is crucial as we face this outbreak; we urge everyone to follow the guidelines issued,” said a health official.

The outbreak of HMPV serves as a reminder of the need for vigilance regarding respiratory illnesses.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling match, Australia claimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after defeating India by 6 wickets, clinching the series 3-1. This win marks a significant moment for Australia, who had not won the trophy in a decade.

  • Travis Head (34*) and Beau Webster (39*) led Australia to victory.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah missed the match due to injury, impacting India's bowling lineup.
  • Australia scored 162 runs to win after India was bowled out for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved a remarkable 10-wicket haul across both innings.
  • India is now out of contention for the World Test Championship Final.
“Unreal. Few of us didn't have. Lived up to all the hype...Immensely proud.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Australia's strong performance throughout the series allowed them to regain the trophy, while India faced challenges due to injuries and missed opportunities.

item.title: Coldplay gets notice against using children ahead of Ahmedabad concert - Business Standard
item.description:
Coldplay gets notice against using children ahead of Ahmedabad concert

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: Business Standard

The District Child Protection Unit in Ahmedabad has issued a notice to Chris Martin and the Coldplay concert organizers, prohibiting the use of children on stage and requiring hearing protection for any minors attending the event.

  • The concert is scheduled for January 25 and 26, 2025, at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
  • Sound levels exceeding 120 decibels could pose health risks to children.
  • Failure to comply with the directives could result in strict action by authorities.
  • The notice responds to a complaint from Pandit Rao Dharnevar, who raises concerns about children's welfare at concerts.
“Involving children in concerts featuring loud sounds and bright lights can harm their physical health and mental development.” - Pandit Rao Dharnevar

This notice echoes concerns raised previously by Dharnevar regarding other concerts, emphasizing the need to protect children's rights in entertainment settings.

item.title: 4 Maoists Gunned Down, 1 Security Personnel Dies In Chhattisgarh Encounter - NDTV
item.description:
Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

An encounter between Maoists and security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of four Maoists and one security personnel. The clash occurred during an anti-Maoist operation in the forests of Narayanpur and Dantewada districts.

  • Four Maoists were killed during a face-off with security personnel.
  • One head constable from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) named Sannu Karam lost his life.
  • Security forces were conducting an anti-Maoist operation when the encounter took place.
  • After the exchange of fire, bodies of the Maoists and their weapons were recovered.
  • In 2024, over 200 Maoists have been killed, with a focus on eradicating this insurgency by March 2026.
  • 18 security personnel have reportedly died in anti-Maoist operations this year, alongside 65 civilians due to Maoist violence.
“Amit Shah vowing to eradicate them by March 2026.”

The ongoing operations highlight the persistent conflict between security forces and Maoist insurgents in the region, with the government emphasizing its commitment to restoring peace.
